answers.answer: Tell her everything thing you are feeling you should write it down now because when we go to the Dr we tent to leave some things out. They Can't help you if they don't know the problem

do you have history of diabetes sometimes your sugar level goes down and you feel shaking inside your bones and feel as if you legs will just bend on you the headache is a sign of not eating on a regular hours the heavy breathing possible due overweight you can ask the doctor to run a test on diabetes and hi blood pressure

i went to the doctor this morning and she said my lymph nodes are swollen and that i have a respratory infection. can this be the cause of passing out in school( i passed out to day in the school bathroom), shaking and breathing heavily? oh, and i was tested for diabetes last week. everything is normal. What else could cause this?

HiWelcome to the MedHelp forum AGAIN!I have written to you earlier too. One big possibility is pinched nerve in the cervical spine region. Neck lymph nodes can be the result of tonsillitis, pharyngitis (infection of upper throat), infection in mouth, caries in tooth, internal ear infection, outer ear infection, eczema, dermatitis, dandruff, breast cancer, fungal infection, other cancers like lymphoma etc. If you had flu like symptoms initially then it could be due to infectious mononucleosis too and this can be very weakening.  Bathroom, wood shop can also be a source of mold spores and this could also have triggered an allergic reaction.Hope this helps. Do discuss this with your doctor and get yourself examined. Take care!

question: Today in woodshop i felt like i was going to pass out. i was shaking uncontrolibly! i was breathing heavily, and i had a headache. im scared! how do i stop.. this? im going to the doctor tomorrow morning! what do i ask her?
title: I'm scared! Please help!
